column2: MISSOURI DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: Missouri

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column4: A steady red light.
column8: A police officer.

column2: 2. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column8: Leave the road immediately.
column10: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

column2: 3. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column6: increase your speed and move to the left.
column8: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column10: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 4. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.
column6: when it is hard to see ahead.
column8: when following motorcycles.

column2: 5. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: proceed with caution through the intersection.
column6: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.
column8: stop and wait for the light to change.
column10: speed up to beat the red light.

column2: 6. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: must enter the roadway immediately.
column6: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
column8: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.

column2: 7. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column4: They always have the right-of-way.
column8: They obey specific traffic laws.
column10: They are hard to see in traffic.

column2: 8. This warning sign means:
column4: Slow down, drive with caution and watch for children
column8: Watch out for children crossing the street

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM

column2: 10. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column4: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.
column6: the condition and type of vehicle tires.
column8: the time of day.

column2: 11. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column6: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column8: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column10: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.

column2: 12. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column4: Mirrors need to be adjusted.
column8: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.
column10: You should look over your shoulder instead.

column2: 13. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You may not turn right
column6: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear
column8: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding

column2: 14. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.
column6: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.
column8: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.
column10: slow down before entering the curve.

column2: 15. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column6: Look through your back window for children.
column8: Rely on your mirrors.

column2: 16. A broken white line:
column4: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column6: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column8: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.

column2: 17. Littering:
column4: is against the law.
column8: may cause a traffic crash.

column2: 18. This sign means:
column4: Do not turn right.
column6: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: The road will curve to the right.

column2: 19. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: accelerate much faster
column8: drive much faster

column2: 20. This sign means:
column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: Reversible lane ahead.

column2: 21. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: prepare to leave the lane safely.
column8: turn off the ignition.
column10: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 22. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______ of your vehicle.
column4: on all sides
column8: only on the left and right side

column2: 23. When changing lanes on a multi-lane highway, you must signal your intentions _________ before changing lanes.
column4: immediately
column8: at least 150 feet

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: No U-Turn
column8: Winding road ahead

column2: 25. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column6: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column8: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column10: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
